current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text: Designating December 3, 2014, as “National Phenylketonuria Awareness Day”.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: That the
designates December 3, 2014, as
encourages all people in the United States to become more informed about phenylketonuria; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
transmit a copy of this resolution to the
			 National PKU Alliance, a non-profit organization dedicated to improving
			 the lives of individuals with phenylketonuria.

text.#text: respectfully requests that the

Whereas phenylketonuria is a rare, inherited metabolic disorder that is characterized by the
			 inability of the body to process the essential amino acid phenylalanine,
			 and which causes intellectual disability and other neurological problems,
			 such as
			 memory loss and mood disorders, when treatment is not started within the
			 first few weeks of life;
Whereas phenylketonuria is also referred to as

Whereas newborn screening for PKU was initiated in the United States in 1963 and was recommended
			 for inclusion in State newborn  screening programs under the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Newborn Screening Saves Lives Act of 2007
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Newborn Screening Saves Lives Act of 2007

text.#text:
Whereas approximately 1 out of every 15,000 infants in the United States is born with
			 PKU;
Whereas PKU is treated with medical food;
Whereas medical foods are medically necessary for children and adults living with PKU;

Whereas adults with PKU who discontinue treatment are at risk for serious medical issues such as
			 depression, impulse control disorder, phobias, tremors, and pareses;

Whereas women with PKU must maintain strict metabolic control before and during
			 pregnancy to prevent fetal damage;

quote.#tail:
, which can cause small brains, intellectual disabilities, birth defects of the heart, and low
			 birth weights;

text.#text: Whereas children born from untreated mothers with PKU may have a condition known as

Whereas gaps in medical foods coverage have a detrimental impact on individuals with PKU, their
			 families, and society;

Whereas scientists and researchers are hopeful that breakthroughs in PKU research will
			 be forthcoming;

Whereas researchers across the United States are conducting important research projects involving
			 PKU; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is an institution that can raise awareness of PKU among the general
			 public and the medical community: Now, therefore, be it

text.#text: Whereas the

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 SRES 585 IS: Designating December 3, 2014, as “National Phenylketonuria Awareness Day”.
